instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I hi every one I had dead MacBook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 
After checking it  I found there was short removed the short, one of the cap was burnt out I'm trying find out we're I can buy one of these please see picture. I don't have spare board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
You have space enough to solder 3x10uF/25V in paralel; easy to find in any normal laptop board.
Board will work w/o that cap, but is good to solder it, for better current pulse support.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Cheers for that I was thinking better to put some thing on there just in case 

Thanks for your help
